messages.subject: RE: [AlwaysLearning] Poem for our children
messages.msgSnippet: Gotta love google :0). We use it so many times a day I don t know what we d do without it! ~Rue Ren said: Well there ya go!! And I was remembering Faith Hill.
messages.messageBody:
Gotta love google :0). We use it so many times a day I don't know what
we'd do without it! ~Rue

Ren said:
"Well there ya go!! And I was remembering Faith Hill.
Thanks for setting that straight Rue. That's what I get for firing off
an
email before finishing the whole digest. :)"

messages.subject: Poem for our children
messages.msgSnippet: In a message dated 4/14/03 12:04:01 PM Central Daylight Time, AlwaysLearning@yahoogroups.com writes:
messages.messageBody:
In a message dated 4/14/03 12:04:01 PM Central Daylight Time,
AlwaysLearning@yahoogroups.com writes:

<< It sounded familiar to me, so I googled. The two you mentioned did
write it. It's a country song sung by Lee Ann Womack. >>

Well there ya go!! And I was remembering Faith Hill.
Thanks for setting that straight Rue. That's what I get for firing off an
email before finishing the whole digest. :)

Ren
"The sun is shining--the sun is shining. That is the magic. The flowers are
growing--the roots are stirring. That is the magic. Being alive is the
magic--being strong is the magic The magic is in me--the magic is in
me....It's in every one of us."

----Frances Hodgson Burnett

messages.subject: Poem for our children
messages.msgSnippet: In a message dated 4/14/03 12:04:01 PM Central Daylight Time, AlwaysLearning@yahoogroups.com writes:
messages.messageBody:
In a message dated 4/14/03 12:04:01 PM Central Daylight Time,
AlwaysLearning@yahoogroups.com writes:

<<
I found this poem in a journal I bought from Borders Bookstore Saturday
night. It's unsigned, so I'll put the names of the people on the cover
as the authors: Mark D. Sanders & Tia Sillers. >>

I have that very same journal! Dh bought it for me on my Birthday last May.
The names you listed are the songwriters actually, it was performed by a
country singer (was it Faith Hill? Can't remember who it was now) and was an
instant hit.
Great message.

Ren
"The sun is shining--the sun is shining. That is the magic. The flowers are
growing--the roots are stirring. That is the magic. Being alive is the
magic--being strong is the magic The magic is in me--the magic is in
me....It's in every one of us."

----Frances Hodgson Burnett
